greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sequence A179016 reduced modulo 2.
comment: It holds for all n>=1 that a(n) = A179016(n)-A213723(A179016(n-1)) meaning that a(n) = 1 when the next node upwards in the infinite trunk of beanstalk sequence (A179016) is the larger of the two possible branches from A179016(n), and 0 when it is the smaller of the said branches. That is, this sequence tells whether A179016 proceeds "left" or "right" at each step.

If we were able to find the values of this sequence "a priori" (without needing the value of A179016 at the same point and taking modulo 2 from it), then A179016 could be computed in a more straightforward "bottom-up manner", as then we would have enough information to find the correct path in the binary tree of beanstalk up to the infinity.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2493
xref: a(n) = A000035(A179016(n)). Binary complement of A213728. Cf. A213730, A213733. Run lengths: A218545.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 01 2012
ext: Offset changed from 1 to 0 by _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 05 2012
